page.title: 02ABINGDON ABBEY (1)
page.content: Abingdon Abbey was founded in 960 and twice destroyed. In 977 King Edward and Archbishop Dunstan ordered Bishop Sideman to be carried to St. Marys Abbey in Abingdon. Abbot Faritius finished building in 1170, the Abbey church was 370 ft long. In the l5th century the Abbey was the greatest abbey in England, except Glastonbury. Most of the Kings and Queens of England were guests at the Abbey, Edward the Confessor, King John, Henry 111, Henry V111 and William the Conqueror who spent Easter there in 1084. King John came to rest at the Abbey. The old gateway of the Abbey was built in the late l5th century. The townsfolk had no love for the Abbey because it told them how to live their lives. The last royal guest was Henry V111 who spent 3 months there to avoid the plague in London.
